x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Students interested in law often struggle to find mentors, understand career paths, or access real-world exposure. Legal education is theory-heavy, and many youth don’t know how to explore fields like cyber law, IP law, human rights, or corporate law. NGOs and law schools want to guide them, but lack scalable, trackable tools. Sponsors want to support legal talent but lack visibility into engagement. This leads to missed opportunities, low confidence, and underrepresentation in legal careers.

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  • App Engine Studio for student profiles, mentor logs, and career modules
  • Flow Designer for challenge routing, badge generation, and sponsor updates
  • UI Builder for dashboards and mobile-friendly views
  • IntegrationHub for syncing with school portals, email/SMS platforms, or legal databases
  • Attachment API for uploading guides, certificates, and session materials
  • QR Code Generation & Base64 Encoding for career maps and mentor invites
  • Scoped App with ACLs for privacy, role-based access, and educator permissions

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

No technical dependencies highlighted for this solution

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Ensuring accuracy and diversity in legal career content
  • Designing a simple, engaging UX for students and mentors
  • Coordinating multi-agency access and mentorship workflows
  • Encouraging ongoing engagement beyond one-time sessions
  • Building trust and visibility for sponsors and educators
